Detailed Description

cache_inode_rdwr.c : performs an IO on a REGULAR_FILE.

Definition in file cache_inode_open_close.c.

Function Documentation

cache_inode_status_t cache_inode_close (  cache_entry_t *  pentry,
cache_inode_client_t *  pclient,
cache_inode_status_t *  pstatus
) 
 

cache_inode_close: closes the local fd in the FSAL.

Closes the local fd in the FSAL.

No lock management is done in this layer: the related pentry in the cache inode layer is locked and will prevent from concurent accesses.

Parameters:
pentry [IN] entry in file content layer whose content is to be accessed.
pclient [IN] ressource allocated by the client for the nfs management. [OUT] returned status.
Returns:
CACHE_CONTENT_SUCCESS is successful .

cache_content_open: opens the local fd on the cache.

Opens the fd on the FSAL

Parameters:
pentry [IN] entry in file content layer whose content is to be accessed.
pclient [IN] ressource allocated by the client for the nfs management.
openflags [IN] flags to be used to open the file
pcontent [IN] FSAL operation context [OUT] returned status.
Returns:
CACHE_CONTENT_SUCCESS is successful .

cache_content_open: opens the local fd on the cache.

Opens the fd on the FSAL

Parameters:
pentry_dir [IN] parent entry for the file
pname [IN] name of the file to be opened in the parent directory
pentry_file [IN] file entry to be opened
pclient [IN] ressource allocated by the client for the nfs management.
openflags [IN] flags to be used to open the file
pcontent [IN] FSAL operation context [OUT] returned status.
Returns:
CACHE_CONTENT_SUCCESS is successful .
